name: Button

signals.name: activate
signals.description:
The ::activate signal on GtkButton is an action signal and
emitting it causes the button to animate press then release. 
Applications should never connect to this signal, but use the
#GtkButton::clicked signal.

signals.name: clicked
signals.description: Emitted when the button has been activated (pressed and released).

signals.name: enter
signals.description: Emitted when the pointer enters the button.

signals.name: leave
signals.description: Emitted when the pointer leaves the button.

signals.name: pressed
signals.description: Emitted when the button is pressed.

signals.name: released
signals.description: Emitted when the button is released.

methods.name: clicked
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::clicked signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: enter
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::enter signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: get_alignment
methods.description: Gets the alignment of the child in the button.

methods.name: get_event_window
methods.description:
Returns the button's event window if it is realized, %NULL otherwise.
This function should be rarely needed.

returns.description: %TRUE if the button grabs focus when it is clicked with

methods.name: get_focus_on_click
methods.description:
Returns whether the button grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse.
See gtk_button_set_focus_on_click().

the mouse.

returns.description: a #GtkWidget or %NULL in case there is no image

methods.name: get_image
methods.description:
Gets the widget that is currenty set as the image of @button.
This may have been explicitly set by gtk_button_set_image()
or constructed by gtk_button_new_from_stock().

methods.name: get_image_position
methods.description:
Gets the position of the image relative to the text 
inside the button.

returns.description: The text of the label widget. This string is owned

methods.name: get_label
methods.description:
Fetches the text from the label of the button, as set by
gtk_button_set_label(). If the label text has not 
been set the return value will be %NULL. This will be the 
case if you create an empty button with gtk_button_new() to 
use as a container.

by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

methods.name: get_relief
methods.description: Returns the current relief style of the given #GtkButton.

returns.description: %TRUE if the button label is used to

methods.name: get_use_stock
methods.description:
Returns whether the button label is a stock item.

select a stock item instead of being
used directly as the label text.

returns.description: %TRUE if an embedded underline in the button label

methods.name: get_use_underline
methods.description:
Returns whether an embedded underline in the button label indicates a
mnemonic. See gtk_button_set_use_underline ().

indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys.

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::leave signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: pressed
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::pressed signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: released
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::released signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: set_alignment

parameters.name: xalign
parameters.description: the horizontal position of the child, 0.0 is left aligned, 1.0 is right aligned

parameters.name: yalign
parameters.description: the vertical position of the child, 0.0 is top aligned, 1.0 is bottom aligned

methods.description:
Sets the alignment of the child. This property has no effect unless 
the child is a #GtkMisc or a #GtkAlignment.

methods.name: set_focus_on_click

parameters.name: focus_on_click
parameters.description: whether the button grabs focus when clicked with the mouse

methods.description:
Sets whether the button will grab focus when it is clicked with the mouse.
Making mouse clicks not grab focus is useful in places like toolbars where
you don't want the keyboard focus removed from the main area of the
application.

methods.name: set_image

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: a widget to set as the image for the button

methods.description:
Set the image of @button to the given widget. Note that
it depends on the #GtkSettings:gtk-button-images setting whether the
image will be displayed or not, you don't have to call
gtk_widget_show() on @image yourself.

methods.name: set_image_position
methods.description:
Sets the position of the image relative to the text 
inside the button.

methods.name: set_label
methods.description:
Sets the text of the label of the button to @str. This text is
also used to select the stock item if gtk_button_set_use_stock()
is used.

This will also clear any previously set labels.

methods.name: set_relief
methods.description:
Sets the relief style of the edges of the given #GtkButton widget.
Three styles exist, GTK_RELIEF_NORMAL, GTK_RELIEF_HALF, GTK_RELIEF_NONE.
The default style is, as one can guess, GTK_RELIEF_NORMAL.

<!-- FIXME: put pictures of each style -->

methods.name: set_use_stock

parameters.name: use_stock
parameters.description: %TRUE if the button should use a stock item

methods.description:
If %TRUE, the label set on the button is used as a
stock id to select the stock item for the button.

methods.name: set_use_underline

parameters.name: use_underline
parameters.description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

methods.description:
If true, an underline in the text of the button label indicates
the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.

methods.name: clicked
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::clicked signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: enter
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::enter signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: leave
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::leave signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: pressed
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::pressed signal to the given #GtkButton.

methods.name: released
methods.description: Emits a #GtkButton::released signal to the given #GtkButton.

properties.name: image
properties.description: The child widget to appear next to the button text.

properties.name: image-position
properties.description: The position of the image relative to the text inside the button.

properties.name: xalign
properties.description:
If the child of the button is a #GtkMisc or #GtkAlignment, this property 
can be used to control its horizontal alignment. 0.0 is left aligned, 
1.0 is right aligned.

properties.name: yalign
properties.description:
If the child of the button is a #GtkMisc or #GtkAlignment, this property 
can be used to control its vertical alignment. 0.0 is top aligned, 
1.0 is bottom aligned.

description:
The #GtkButton widget is generally used to trigger a callback function that is
called when the button is pressed.  The various signals and how to use them
are outlined below.

The #GtkButton widget can hold any valid child widget.  That is, it can hold
almost any other standard #GtkWidget.  The most commonly used child is the
#GtkLabel.
